SetUserDisabledDialog.disableUser.text: Do you really want to disable user {username}? Disabling the user {username} will forbid them from logging in. Their existing sessions will also become invalid.
SetUserDisabledDialog.enableUser.title: Enable User
SetUserDisabledDialog.enableUser.text: Do you really want to enable user {username}? Enable the user {username} so that they can login again. Their existing sessions can resume.

Are you sure to terminate all sessions of the user?
AuthenticationLoginIDSettingsScreen.colu: Higher priority Login ID will be shown first. E.g. if you enable both phone and email as Login ID and phone have higher priority, it will show Phone number first in login and signup screen
AuthenticationLoginIDSettingsScreen.erro: Require at least 1 active calling code
AuthenticationLoginIDSettingsScreen.emai: Ignore dot (.) in local part (e.g. john.doe@acme.com = johndoe@acme.com)
Allow plus (+) in local part (e.g. john+app1@gmail.com)
Some email provider use "+" as an alias for multiple email forwarding to the same address. Enable this option if you want a stricter uniqueness for users per email account.
AuthenticatorConfigurationScreen.title: Authenticators
AuthenticatorConfigurationScreen.descrip: Configure how you want users to authenticate themselves (such as Password), and any MFA requirements
Required if user has Multi-factor Authenticator
Required if user enabled Multi-factor Authenticator
Allow user to retrieve or regenerate recovery code again
VerificationConfigurationScreen.title: User Verification
VerificationConfigurationScreen.descript: Configure if the email or phone number of your users could be verified and if it is required
VerificationConfigurationScreen.criteria: At least one user's email/phone is verified
AnonymousUsersConfigurationScreen.title: Anonymous Users
AnonymousUsersConfigurationScreen.descri: Enable or disable anonymous users. Anonymous users do not have identity. They can be promoted to normal users.
AnonymousUsersConfigurationScreen.confli: User identity conflict when promote to normal user
SingleSignOnConfigurationScreen.title: Single-Sign On
SingleSignOnConfigurationScreen.descript: Configure and enable your users to login via SSO. Read the {Link, react, href{{HREF}} target{_blank} children{SSO integration guide}} if you need help
SingleSignOnConfigurationScreen.widget.w: For mobile app only, to receive delegate call when user click on login with WeChat button.
OAuthBranding.wechat.web: Sign in with WeChat (Web/网站应用)
OAuthBranding.wechat.mobile: Sign in with WeChat (Mobile/移动应用)

PasswordPolicyConfigurationScreen.descri: Configure the password policy if Password is configurate as primary authenticators.
PasswordPolicyConfigurationScreen.histor: No. of password history to keep
ForgotPasswordConfigurationScreen.title: Forgot Password
CORSConfigurationScreen.title: Allowed Origins
CORSConfigurationScreen.desc: Configure cross-origin resource sharing (CORS), allowing HTTP requests from the list of domains specified here.

EditOAuthClientScreen.title: Edit Application
ModifyOAuthClientForm.redirect-uris-tool: Users will be redirected to this path after they have authenticated.
ModifyOAuthClientForm.post-logout-redire: Users will be redirected to this path after they have logged out.
ModifyOAuthClientForm.is-first-party-cli: First-party application may request access to sensitive user information and operations
ModifyOAuthClientForm.issue-jwt-access-t: Using JWT as access token allows easier access token decoding
CustomDomainListScreen.title: Custom Domains
CustomDomainListScreen.desc: You can add a custom domain so that users will login via, for example, “identity.yourdomain.com”. In this case, a session cookie of domain “yourdomain.com” is written so that your websites can share the session cookies under “*.yourdomain.com” for better customers experiences.
CustomDomainListScreen.delete-domain-dia: Are you sure you want to delete {domain}
You have no permission to delete domain
CustomDomainListScreen.activate-domain-d: Are you sure you want to activate {domain}? Only one domain can be active.
VerifyDomainScreen.title: Verify Domain
VerifyDomainScreen.desc-main: Setup CNAME and add TXT record below to your DNS provider to verify your own
VerifyDomainScreen.error.non-custom-veri: Cannot find domain which is non-custom and verified
VerifyDomainScreen.error.duplicated-erro: Requested domain is already in use
VerifyDomainScreen.error.not-custom-erro: Requested domain is not a custom domain
ManageLanguageWidget.title: Language
ManageLanguageWidget.default-language-de: For any languages you don’t provide localization, your default language will be used.
UISettingsScreen.title: UI Settings
UISettingsScreen.description: Authgear comes with some simple styling for your login and signup page. You can customize the look and feel here.
UISettingsScreen.app-name-label: It will be used as some placeholder text for your authentication screen, emails, etc. You can always change it later.
UISettingsScreen.privacy-policy-link-des: This link can lead users to your privacy policy
UISettingsScreen.terms-of-service-link-d: This link can lead users to your terms of service
UISettingsScreen.default-client-uri-desc: If this link is provided, a Back to Your App link will be shown in the settings.
UISettingsScreen.default-redirect-uri-de: If this link is provided, the user will be redirected after login with non-OAuth flow.
UISettingsScreen.default-post-logout-red: If this link is provided, the user will be redirected after logout with non-OAuth flow.
